info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 9:21AM MST until August 02 at 11:15AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 1115 AM MST /1115 AM PDT/. * At 921 AM MST /921 AM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Needles, Arizona Village, Mohave Valley, Mojave Ranch Estates, Mesquite Creek, Highway 95 And I-40 and Willow Valley. This includes the following roads... State Route 95 in Mohave County between mile markers 228 and 237. Highway 95 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 54 and 59. Oatman Highway between mile markers 8 and 12. Interstate 40 in California between mile markers 133 and 147. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
